headline.main: FOE WILD IN MOVES TO HARRY GILBERTS; 3 Torpedo Planes Shot Into Sea by 2 U.S. Destroyers, Which Escape Damage

lead_paragraph: PEARL HARBOR, Dec. 2 -- The Japanese are making isolated air attacks against our newly won bases in the Gilbert Islands and we are continuing our air attacks on the Marshalls, Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, Commander in Chief of the Pacific Fleet, said in a press release issued this afternoon.
abstract: US planes raid Mili and Taroa; 2 US destroyers repel Jap air attack, Gilberts area; Tarawa airfield reptd in use by US planes; US air base construction, Makin, discussed; Tarawa battle scenes illus
